div.p: Conversion of Skills. The actual formula is level = log10(19 * skill/100/(1 - skill/100)) in the range 5 - 95. Beyond 95, the formula is 3.5 log10(x - 94) + 25.4. Below the regression is 1:1. as shown in the table.
Conversion of Attributes. The actual formula is level = 2 * (attribute - 10.5).

Where multiple scalable dimensions are given, a certain skill level only applies to one, i.e. of multiple dimensions shall be increased, multiple skill levels must be available. Specialties apply as per "original" rules, in particular at higher levels, for each skill. The source for the skill names is Harnmaster 3.

Learning is modelled by succeeding an active roll with level against a passive level of the current skill. Note that rolling 10 non-stop events can be shortened into rolling a with a . Learning is not applicable to attributes.

Such rolls may be made once a month in which the skill was used reasonably often. Usually only three such rolls apply. A combined roll with the SB is made, with a bonus for equal skill of (see the main page on Combination). A teacher can also be combined with his own skill - and a bonus (row index) of . This assumes that the teacher is available almost always during that time.

Example: Suppose your skill is at , your teacher has a skill of and your SB is a . According to the rules, we should first take the highest of the three parameters to be combined into a single skill roll. That is and ( - ). The third is . (Remember your active level is in this case.) Taking the difference of the first two, we have a column index of into the combination table and we read in the fifth row a , which will be added to (the higher of the two numbers) to yield an . To add in the third (), we take the difference again () as column index and find in the fifth row a that is added to the previous result () for a total of . That is the active skill level to roll against your current skill level () to improve. We are pitting a against a with roughly an 80% chance of success and upon success the skill level is increased to .

For career development, take the sum of the number of all SBs (e.g. SB/2 and SB/3 would be 5) for a career. Now take the duration of learning for that career in months (e.g. 4 years) and multiply by (e.g. 144), which is the number of rolls. This number should be distributed among the skills according to the multiplicity among the skills (e.g. 2/5 for 58 and 3/5 for 86). Any base addtion, such as scripts, count as SB for every points, including any fractions thereof.
Assume that the PC in question has an SB of in all phyiscal attributes and - in all other cases. His sunsign is Ulandus.

Family Skills: Assume that the PC stays with his family until the age of 14. Assume his parents are Animal Trainers. The PCs is exposed to the skills according to his interest and can decide on how to distribute 4 * 12 * 3 = 144 rolls. Let's assume the PCs puts all into Animal Craft. His net SB is (1 - 1 - 1)/3 + 1/2, which we round to . He has no teacher in this phase, he just picks things up as they gain his interest. Adding his own starting skill of to through the table, gives a . This means that the PCs gains 17 after 131 rolls. The remaining 13 rolls are lost, can be rolled individually, or spread among the other available family skills.

Note that generally NN should have a , so adding is actually only making learning more difficult From the previous example we infer that NN would get a bonus of , which gives him 27 rolls. Our PC has an SB of (1 + 1 + 1)/3 + 2/2, which is . Adding this to the skill level, we get as total. This gives us 23 rolls needed to reach . The remaining 4 rolls can only be used individually.

Occupational skills: Our PC chooses to be an Apothecary, a profession with an apprenticeship of 6 years. That means a total of 6 * 12 * 3 = 216 rolls. Script being in the selection of skills counts as 1 + 70/20 = 4 1/2 SB. For Herblore this means the PC gets 216 * 4 / (14 1/2) = 60 (rounded) rolls. His SB is (-1 -1 -1)/3 + 3/2 = 1, rounded up in favor of the PC. This time a teacher will provide a bonus of . Adding this together with the (starting) skill level of , this yields a . We extend the table above to get to a skill level of 18 with 57 rolls. As always, the remaining rolls can be used individually, can be redistributed with other skills, or forfeited.

Optional skills: Any number of years can be used to improve other skills in the manner above. A teacher of skill level can be assumed, unless a guilded profession is required for the skill and the PC is not member of that guild. Then probably no teacher is available, which can mean that a learning penalty of may be applied, if reality cannot be assumed as "teacher". A teacher applies to veteran points and militia duty, which are treated in the same way as regular acquisition of optional skills..

ul.li: Level 0: NN barely knows that a domain for such knowledge exists. With some luck, he can guess whether a general topic belongs to that domain or not.
Level 5: A single topic, one of the most obvious ones has been heard of and can be applied, but without guaranteed success.
Level 10: With this level, the basic concepts are known, the more esoteric concepts have been heard of but cannot be applied.
Level 15: Most concepts are known and many can be applied with a high degree of certainty. There are still areas which can be polished.
Level 20: All concepts of the domain are known and can be applied with confidence. There are only a few topics escaping the grasps of this expert.
Level 25: All of the domain is understood with ease. It is hard to find unknown territory, although it exists. Improvement of the art can be conducted.
Level 30: Mastery of the subject matter as far as humanly possible. Genuine research or creation of new substance is possible.

Humans can accelerate and decalerate as 3 m/s each second. Turning options are in parts of a full circle (centered around the direction of travel). E.g. at 3 m/s this means 60° off the direction of travel on either side per second. For the sake of playability variance in this should be suppressed, although a 20% spread (for a level difference) with Agility modification could be apprpriate.

Piety: Serves as skill for specific magic/religious rituals.
Level 0: NN knows that the reigion exist but cannot separate it from other convocations.
Level 5: Lip service payed to the religion and ability to separate it from other major faiths.
Level 10: The main tenants of the religion are known and followed on individual level. Sects or heresies are not considered.
Level 15: The religion is quoted often and other faiths routinely treated underhanded. Proselytizing is rarely attempted.
Level 20: At this level the adherent is actively seeking to further the tenants of the religion outside of his immediate domain. Distinction between inner-religion minutiae are important.
Level 25: Heresy is abhorred more than other religions. Support for the religion takes precendents over other interests almost always.
Level 30: The adherent is a prophet for the religion and accepts otherwise serious consequences for following details of his faith. May invent rituals and the like.

div.p: Several factors determine how long it takes to bring a combat skill to bear. A premature roll can be made, by taking a penalty that matches the premature time to the ijury dimension. Note that such a time interval is used looking for openings, keeping ones own balance, etc. and must be actively chosen. A point in time cannot be chosen, let alone decided upon on the spur of a moment The active level is determined by adding Initiative and the Combat skill used to attack through row . The passive level is determined by Dodge and the Combat skill used to block or parry; also through row . The Dodge skill may be but Agility may be added through row .

The A/D numbers are used as additional modifiers (divided by five). Using a weapon or a combination in the wrong hand implies a penalty of-. In general, most bonusses and penalties apply to the Time dimension.
Aborted actions will be resolved as if intended that way. For playability reasons partial effects will not be applied until the action is completed.

The weapon and armour B/E/P values each are subtracted from each other individually, and the results are all added to the injury dimension. Using certain aspects of the weapon are a choice on part of the attacker, the defender usually cannot choose to ignore parts of his bonus.
The time dimension can be increased in order to reduce or increase the injury dimension.
Wounds are treated individually for recovery (see below). Injury is applied directly as penalty to the active side of any skill or attribute roll on part of the individual injured.

All impediments affect all types of activity. Use the wound/damage (being negative) as passive level, and use either Stamina (live objects) or Quality (dead objects) as active. Add any attending physician through . Healing is only possible during rest. Dead objects do not heal but are repaired.
A roll is made every time the wound turns into a new penalty (until it reaches zero). The result row shows the number of days to wait, before one point is removed.

Sometimes wounds are dire enough that life leaves the body. This is simulated by rolling against a difficulty of -45 every day. Without modifiers, this gives you a life-expectancy of upward of 50 years and normally this is not rolled at all. But wounds are added to the skill of , making it more likely to happen.

To improve pragmatics, we first only roll the active roll, but roll against 50 and the second measure, we roll at the same as the wound level is modified, but with a modifier of the number of days spent.

Suppose our character starts out with a wound of -20 at day , has a Stamina of and a physician with a skill of 19 constantly attends him. Through the combination table (row , this gives a bonus of +24. A heal roll of +3 gives a total of + 3 + 24 - 20 = 7. The kill roll equals + against -30, which is obviously successful. This mean after days the wound total is reduced by to 19. On day , another roll is made under the same conditions and -4 yields a total of - 4 + 24 - 19 = 1, which means additional days, so the character will reduce his wounds to 18 on day . However, on day a "kill" roll is made against -31, this roll is modified by + for the number of days. We track the complete process in the following table.
